intro: Epilobium cochinchinense, commonly known as the Vietnamese willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its erect or semi-woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Epilobium cochinchinense is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
